problem.markdown: When isotherms for a Van der Waals gas are plotted on a [mathjaxinline]p–V[/mathjaxinline] diagram, which of the following are true? [x] At high temperature, the isotherms approximate rectangular hyperbolas. [x] At the critical point, the tangent to the isotherm is horizontal (parallel to the [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]-axis). [x] At the critical point, the tangent to the isotherm crosses that isotherm. [x] At temperatures lower that the critical temperature, the isotherms do not represent the behaviour of any real fluid.
